book.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them

book.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a set of things such as stamps, matches, or tickets, held together inside a paper cover
book.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: one of the parts that a very large book such as the Bible is divided into

book.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with book
book.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0]: You read something in a book
I read about him in a book at school
book.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1]: You say a book about a subject or a book on a subject
book.translation[0].note_box[1].items[2]: A book of essays, poems etc is one that contains several essays, poems etc
It’s a book of interviews with artists
book.translation[0].note_box[1].items[3]: You say a book by someone
I’m reading a book by John Gray
I’m reading a book of John Gray
book.translation[0].note_box[2].sections: types of book
novel
a book about imaginary people and events
The film is based on Nick Hornby’s best-selling novel.
a historical novel
fiction
books that describe imaginary people and events
She reads a lot of romantic fiction.
literature
novels and plays that are considered to be important works of art
I’m studying American literature at university.
non-fiction
books that describe real people and events
Men tend to prefer non-fiction.
science fiction
books about imaginary events in the future or space travel
reference book
a book such as a dictionary or encyclopedia, which you look at to find information
textbook
a book about a particular subject that you use in a classroom
set book
a book that you have to study as part of your course
guidebook
a book telling visitors about a city or country
picture book
a book for children with many pictures in it
hardcover/hardback
a book that has a hard stiff cover
paperback
a book that has a paper cover
biography
a book about a real person’s life, written by another person
autobiography
a book that someone has written about their own life
recipe book/cookery book
a book that tells you how to cook different meals
book.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future
book.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Have you booked a holiday this year?
The flight was already fully booked (=no more seats were available).
To get tickets, you have to book in advance.
The show’s booked solid (=all the tickets have been sold) until February.
book.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to arrange for someone such as a singer to perform on a particular date
book.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The band was booked for a benefit show in Los Angeles.
book.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to arrange for someone to go to a hotel, fly on a plane etc
book.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: I’ve booked you a flight on Saturday.
I’ll book you in at the Hilton.
book.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to put someone’s name officially in police records, along with the charge made against them
book.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Smith was booked on suspicion of attempted murder.
book.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: when a referee in a sports game books a player who has broken the rules, he or she officially writes down the player’s name in a book as a punishment

book.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the accounting records of a business

book.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a list of a company’s clients and orders for goods
